bug.short_desc: Push all versions to Dev. Channel

assigned_to.name: Nobody; OK to take it and work on it

long_desc.thetext:
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; zh-CN; rv:1.9.2.16) Gecko/20110319 Firefox/3.6.16 Build Identifier:
Please push both the dev. versions and public versions (reviewed or not) to the Dev. Channel.
Reproducible: Always

From the Development Channel caution info at https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/load-tabs-progressively/ "To stop receiving development updates, reinstall the default version" seems to imply that pushing a public version to the dev channel will stop development updates.
If I'm getting updates from the dev channel, I don't want dev channel updates to stop and put me on the release channel as soon as a public version is released.

I think you're misunderstanding that caution, Alan.
Install from the Dev Channel, and you subscribe to it for updates (and if you had been subscribed to the Release Channel, you get unsubscribed from it).
Install from the Release Channel, and you subscribe to *that* for updates (and if you had been subscribed to the Dev Channel, you get unsubscribed from it).
To me, the fact that the same "issue" is published down both Channels does not (and should not) imply changing your subscription to either.
